decks.notes: This Temur Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents and gaining card advantage while eventually winning with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Field of the Dead. It includes a variety of counterspells like Force of Negation, Cryptic Command, and Spell Snare to control the board, alongside removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrade. The deck also utilizes card draw and recursion with Archmage's Charm, Wrenn and Six, and Mystic Sanctuary. Overall, the key strategy is to outvalue opponents and eventually overwhelm them with strong threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of powerful planeswalkers and removal spells, while also utilizing extra turn spells to generate advantage and close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support a variety of colors for the spells and abilities of the deck. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up card advantage and tempo to eventually overwhelm them with powerful threats and repeated actions. It aims to establish a dominant position on the battlefield and dictate the pace and outcome of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing low-cost aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also using direct damage spells such as Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. By continuously pressuring the opponent with fast and efficient threats, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze further intensifies the aggressive strategy, while cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack provide additional reach and versatility.

The deck revolves around quickly playing and buffing up Death's Shadow to take advantage of its power/toughness equal to our life total. Utilizing aggro creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Scourge of the Skyclaves, and Bomat Courier along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage quickly. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a companion to provide additional value by recurring low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck aims to aggressively pressure the opponent and win through reducing their life total to zero.

This deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creature cards as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck has a mana base that enables it to consistently cast Eldrazi creatures and also has some utility lands for additional disruption. The goal of the deck is to apply pressure early and maintain board control with its powerful threats.

The deck revolves around assembling the Heliod/ Spike Feeder combo to gain infinite life and create an infinitely large creature, overwhelming the opponent. It includes cards like Collected Company and Eladamri's Call to search for key pieces, as well as cards like Conclave Mentor and Ranger-Captain of Eos to support the combo and protect it. The deck also includes utility cards like Giver of Runes and Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes cards like Utopia Sprawl to ramp up mana quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion and self-mill strategies to quickly assemble a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By leveraging cards like Creeping Chill and Sword of the Meek alongside creatures like Balustrade Spy and Vengevine, the deck can create explosive turns that allow for massive damage output. The lack of reliance on lands allows for a more streamlined and consistent gameplay experience, enabling the player to quickly and efficiently execute their game plan without worrying about mana constraints.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and resources through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Uro and Omnath, while also generating value with cards like Wrenn and Six and Cryptic Command. The deck seeks to outvalue its opponent by generating tokens with cards like Field of the Dead and overwhelming them with its versatile spell options. The goal is to grind out the opponent and control the game until victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful creatures and versatile control spells. Utilizing cards like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for card advantage and threats, while using counter spells like Force of Negation and Mana Leak to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes utility lands like Field of the Dead and Mystic Sanctuary to generate additional value and out grind opponents in the long game. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory is achieved.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers, efficient removal spells, and extra turn effects. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while generating value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wrenn and Six. By utilizing versatile spells like Cryptic Command and Time Warp, along with the mana fixing offered by the land base, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until it can secure a victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively reduce your own life total in order to power up Death's Shadow and Scourge of the Skyclaves, while utilizing efficient removal and hand disruption spells to control the opponent's board and hand. Mishra's Bauble and Wrenn and Six provide card advantage and help to manipulate the top of your deck, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion option that can help recur key creatures and spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to close out games swiftly through a combination of large, efficient threats and direct damage.

The deck focuses on assembling the Heliod Spike combo using cards like Spike Feeder, Heliod, Sun-Crowned, and Walking Ballista to gain infinite life and deal infinite damage to the opponent. It also includes cards like Giver of Runes and Ranger-Captain of Eos to protect the combo pieces and tutor for them. By ramping with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf, as well as utilizing Collected Company for card advantage, the deck aims to quickly set up the combo and win the game before the opponent can react.

The main concept of this Jund deck is to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan through hand disruption and removal spells. By utilizing powerful cards like Tarmogoyf, Liliana of the Veil, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply early pressure and control the board state. Additionally, cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Kroxa provide card advantage and additional threats to overwhelm the opponent. The land base is optimized to ensure consistent mana sources for all three colors in order to consistently cast the powerful spells in the deck.

The deck is focused on playing aggressive red creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key concept is to quickly empty your hand and refill it with cards like Light Up the Stage and Seasoned Pyromancer, while also using cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Bonecrusher Giant to control the board. Obosh, the Preypiercer acts as a companion to give a consistent source of extra damage. The inclusion of Blood Moon and Blast Zone can disrupt the opponent's game plan and give you the edge in the match.

The deck focuses on using control elements like counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Farseek. The main win condition is to assemble the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent in one turn. Cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wrenn and Six provide card advantage and additional value to outlast opponents in longer games. The deck aims to control the game until it can assemble its combo and win.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while setting up for a game-winning combo with Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wrenn and Six provide additional value and card advantage, while Growth Spiral helps ramp into the combo. With a mix of control elements and a powerful win condition, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly assembling the pieces for a devastating finish with Scapeshift.

This deck utilizes a combination of efficient removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines to outvalue and control opponents. It focuses on ramping into powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and generating advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Wrenn and Six. The mana base is optimized to support the three colors of the Temur color combination while also incorporating utility lands like Field of the Dead and Mystic Sanctuary. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence.
